title: States lifting coronavirus restrictions are ‘small mercies’
text:
States across Australia are beginning to lift some of their coronavirus lockdown restrictions which may be “small mercies, but small mercies on our way back” to normality says Sky News host Paul Murray.

Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk, who was one of the “more conservative in all this,” is one of the first state leaders to start to “plot a fair-dinkum way out of this,” Mr Murray said.

Premier Palaszczuk announced restrictions on family gatherings will be somewhat eased including allowing people within a household to go out for a picnic, while also lifting restrictions on non-essential shopping.

Western Australia Premier Mark McGowan announced similar easing of restrictions, while Victoria has refused to follow in Queensland and WA’s footsteps.

Image: AP
